result.execSummary:
Mark E Cook was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Mark E Cook was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark E Cook

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: For both 12/02/15 @ 9 am. and 12/04/15 @ 3 pm. court dates.
Copy of Original Waiver with Waiver of Extradition filed by Waukesha County Sheriff's Department, advising that the State of Illinois took the defendant into custody on December 7, 2015.

Warrant for Commitment.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 12/04/15.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 12/04/15.

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Mark E Cook in court.  

Defendant has charges pending out of the State of Illinois.
Defendant waives his right to an attorney and also waives his right to an extradition hearing.
Court conducts the waiver colloquy with the defendant.
Court is satisfied the defendant is freely and voluntarily waiving his right to an attorney and right to a extradition hearing.
Court Accepts the defendant's waiver.

Court Signs the Waiver of Extradition and Warrant for Commitment.

State of Illinois can be notified to pick up the defendant.
If the defendant is picked up by the next court date it can be removed from the calendar, if he is not picked up court will address bail.
  Hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Mark E Cook in court, in custody.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel and wishes to waive the extradition.  Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
